metadata.title: CVE-2019-6799 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in phpMyAdmin before 4.8.5. When theAllowArbitraryServer configuration setting is set to true, with the use ofa rogue MySQL server, an attacker can read any file on the server that theweb server's user can access. This is related to themysql.allow_local_infile PHP configuration, and the inadvertent ignoring of"options(MYSQLI_OPT_LOCAL_INFILE" calls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-6799` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.9.2+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.9.2+dfsg1-1').
